com.openxc.remote
Class RemoteVehicleService

java.lang.Object
  android.content.Context
      android.content.ContextWrapper
          android.app.Service
              com.openxc.remote.RemoteVehicleService
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks
public class RemoteVehicleService
extends android.app.Service

The RemoteVehicleService is the centralized source of all vehicle data. To minimize overhead, only one object connects to the current vehicle data source (e.g. a CAN translator or trace file being played back) and all application requests are eventually propagated back to this service. Applications should not use this service directly, but should bind to the in-process VehicleService instead - that has an interface that respects Measurement types. The interface used for the RemoteVehicleService is purposefully primative as there are a small set of objects that can be natively marshalled through an AIDL interface. The service initializes and connects to the vehicle data source when bound. The data source is selected by the application by passing extra data along with the bind Intent - see the onBind(Intent) method for details.

onCreate

Overrides:
onCreate in class android.app.Service

onDestroy

public void onDestroy()
Shut down any associated services when this service is about to die. This stops the data source (e.g. stops trace playback) and kills the thread used for notifying measurement listeners.

Overrides:
onDestroy in class android.app.Service

onBind

public android.os.IBinder onBind(android.content.Intent intent)
Initialize the service and data source when a client binds to us. An application can select a vehicle data source by passing extra data with the bind Intent. The two parameters are: RemoteVehicleService.DATA_SOURCE_NAME_EXTRA The name of a class implementing the VehicleDataSourceInterface. RemoteVehicleService.DATA_SOURCE_RESOURCE_EXTRA An optional initializer for the data source - this will be passed to its constructor as a String. An example is a path to a file if the data source is a trace file playback. For example, to use the trace to playback a trace file, bind to the RemoteVehicleService with an Intent like this: Intent intent = new Intent(); intent.setClass(getContext(), RemoteVehicleService.class); intent.putExtra(RemoteVehicleService.DATA_SOURCE_NAME_EXTRA, TraceVehicleDataSource.class.getName()); intent.putExtra(RemoteVehicleService.DATA_SOURCE_RESOURCE_EXTRA, "resource://" + R.raw.tracejson); bindService(intent, connection, Context.BIND_AUTO_CREATE); If no data source is specified, the UsbVehicleDataSource will be used by default with the a default USB device ID.

Specified by:
onBind in class android.app.Service
